briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Linagliptin (5 mg Administered Orally Once Daily) Over 24 Weeks in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Insufficient Glycaemic Control Despite Metformin Therapy
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Parallel Group Efficacy and Safety Study of BI 1356 Over 24 Weeks in T2D Patients With Insufficient Glycaemic Control Despite Metformin Therapy
summary: In this randomised, double-blind, parallel group trial, the safety and efficacy of 5 mg of Linagliptin administered orally once daily will be compared with a placebo after 24 weeks of treatment as add-on therapy to metformin in patients with type 2 diabetes and insufficient glycaemic control.

primaryOutcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 24
